intro: Pentacaena congesta, commonly known as the clustered pentachaena, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and grayish-green, with a rough texture. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, giving the plant its common name.
